(Werecreature) Change Shape.name: (Werecreature) Change Shape
(Werecreature) Change Shape.description:
The werecreature changes into its humanoid, hybrid, or animal shape. Each shape has a specific, persistent appearance. A true werecreature's natural form is its hybrid shape.

In humanoid shape, the werecreature uses its original humanoid size, loses its jaws and claws Strikes, and gains a melee fist Strike that deals bludgeoning damage equal to the slashing damage dealt by its claw.

In animal shape, its Speed and size change to that of the animal, it gains any special Strike effects of the animal that it didn't already have (such as Grab), and it loses its weapon Strikes.

@Localize[PF2E.NPC.Abilities.Glossary.ChangeShape]

(Divine Warden) Divine Domain Spells.name: (Divine Warden) Divine Domain Spells
(Divine Warden) Divine Domain Spells.description: The divine warden selects two of its patron deity's domains. The divine warden can cast the basic domain spell for its chosen domains. The divine warden has a focus pool of 1 Focus Point. It can't Refocus, but its focus pool automatically refills 24 hours after it last used a Focus Point. If the divine warden is at least 10th level, it also gains the advanced domain spells for its chosen domains, and its focus pool increases to 2 Focus Points.

(Ghost) Telekinetic Assault.name: (Ghost) Telekinetic Assault
(Ghost) Telekinetic Assault.description: The ghost cries out in pain and anguish as small objects and debris fly about in a 30-foot emanation. Creatures in this area take [[/r {1d6}[bludgeoning]]]{1d6 bludgeoning damage} + 1d6 per 2 levels, subject to a basic Reflex save.

(Ghost) Beatific Appearance.name: (Ghost) Beatific Appearance
(Ghost) Beatific Appearance.description:
Requirements A creature the ghost is aware of targets the ghost with an attack;

Effect The ghost has an unusually pitiable appearance or can change its features to look like someone close to the attacker, which causes the target to pull back on its attack.

The triggering creature must attempt a Will save. On a failure, the creature takes a -1 circumstance penalty to its attack roll (-2 on a critical failure).

(Visitant) Wrestle.name: (Visitant) Wrestle
(Visitant) Wrestle.description: The visitant makes a claw Strike against a creature it has @Compendium[pf2e.conditionitems.kWc1fhmv9LBiTuei]{Grabbed}. If the attack hits, that creature is knocked @Compendium[pf2e.conditionitems.j91X7x0XSomq8d60]{Prone}.

(Ghost) Lynchpin.name: (Ghost) Lynchpin
(Ghost) Lynchpin.description:
The ghost extends some of its nature to one or more undead of equal or lower level, who are connected to the ghost's story and unfinished business.

These undead gain the ghost's @Compendium[pf2e.bestiary-family-ability-glossary.unR8VVR4yyRnsmnB]{Rejuvenation} ability and can't be permanently destroyed so long as the ghost exists. If the ghost is laid to rest, all linked undead are likewise instantly destroyed.

Linked undead often, but not always, share the ghost's @Compendium[pf2e.bestiary-family-ability-glossary.BcSlVpaN72LoQ5BV]{Site Bound} ability as well. The ghost doesn't have any control over such undead, and indeed the ghost and their partners in eternity may be unremittingly hostile to one another.

(Vampire, Basic) Vampire Weaknesses.name: (Vampire, Basic) Vampire Weaknesses
(Vampire, Basic) Vampire Weaknesses.description:
All vampires possess the following weaknesses.

  • Compulsions Vampires are creatures of strange and unknowable compulsions. A typical vampire can't voluntarily cross running water unless it is transported while it hides within its coffin, nor can it enter a private dwelling unless invited in by someone with the authority to do so. At your discretion, vampires might have different compulsions-a pirate vampire might not be able to set foot on solid ground without being invited, for example. The vampire can still be forced to do these things and might be able to overcome its compulsion just as it does its revulsion.
  • Revulsion A vampire can't voluntarily come within 10 feet of brandished garlic or a brandished religious symbol of a non-evil deity. To brandish garlic or a religious symbol, a creature must Interact to do so for 1 round (similar to Raising a Shield). If the vampire involuntarily comes within 10 feet of an object of its revulsion, it gains the @Compendium[pf2e.conditionitems.sDPxOjQ9kx2RZE8D]{Fleeing} condition, running from the object of its revulsion until it ends an action beyond 10 feet. After 1 round of being exposed to the subject of its revulsion, a vampire can attempt a Will save as a single action, which has the concentrate trait. On a success, it overcomes its revulsions for [[/br 1d6 #rounds]]{1d6 rounds} (or 1 hour on a critical success).
  • Stake A wooden stake driven through a vampire's heart drops the vampire to 0 HP and prevents it from healing above 0 HP, even in its coffin. Staking a vampire requires three actions and works only if the vampire is unconscious. If the stake is removed, the vampire can heal above 0 HP again, and if it's in its coffin the 1-hour rest period begins once the stake is removed. If the vampire's head is severed and anointed with @Compendium[pf2e.equipment-srd.efFe4EK7ThUrH446]{Holy Water} while the stake is in place, the vampire is destroyed.
  • Sunlight If exposed to direct sunlight, a vampire immediately becomes @Compendium[pf2e.conditionitems.xYTAsEpcJE1Ccni3]{Slowed 1}. The slowed value increases by 1 each time the vampire ends its turn in sunlight. If the vampire loses all its actions in this way, it is destroyed. Due to their supernatural aversion to light, vampires don't cast shadows or show a reflection in mirrors.

(Graveknight) Graveknight's Curse.name: (Graveknight) Graveknight's Curse
(Graveknight) Graveknight's Curse.description:
This curse affects anyone who wears a graveknight's armor for at least 1 hour.

Saving Throw Will save;

Onset 1 hour;

Stage 1 @Compendium[pf2e.conditionitems.3uh1r86TzbQvosxv]{Doomed 1} and cannot remove the armor (1 day);

Stage 2 @Compendium[pf2e.conditionitems.3uh1r86TzbQvosxv]{Doomed 2}, the creature's Speed is reduced by 10, and cannot remove the armor (1 day);

Stage 3 dies and transforms into the armor's graveknight.

(Ghost) Pyre's Memory.name: (Ghost) Pyre's Memory
(Ghost) Pyre's Memory.description:
The ghost causes great gouts of flame to erupt without warning.

The ghost picks three 5-foot squares within 30 feet. Creatures that start in or enter one of these squares take [[/r {1d6}[fire]]]{1d6 fire damage} per 2 levels the ghost has, subject to a basic Reflex save.

The flames last for 1 minute and don't set other things alight unless the ghost wishes. If the ghost uses this ability again, it dismisses any existing flames.

(Graveknight) Weapon Master.name: (Graveknight) Weapon Master
(Graveknight) Weapon Master.description:
The graveknight has access to the critical specialization effects of any weapons it wields.

As NPC strikes are not generated from the weapons it holds, this feature cannot be automated. Add a "Note" rule element to each of the graveknight's strikes for the correct critical specialization.

(Graveknight) Ruinous Weapons.name: (Graveknight) Ruinous Weapons
(Graveknight) Ruinous Weapons.description:
At the time of its creation, a graveknight chooses one of the following energy types that was relevant to its life or death: acid, cold, electricity, or fire.

Any weapon the graveknight wields gains the effects of the caustic, frost, shock, or flaming weapon rune, respectively, in addition to a +1 striking weapon rune.

If the graveknight is 14th level or higher, its weapons instead gain the effects of the greater versions of both of these runes.

(Lich) Blasphemous Utterances.name: (Lich) Blasphemous Utterances
(Lich) Blasphemous Utterances.description:
@Template[type:emanation|distance:10]{10 Feet} @Compendium[pf2e.bestiary-ability-glossary-srd.v61oEQaDdcRpaZ9X]{Aura}

The lich is accompanied by a constant echo of blasphemous murmurs and tainted whispers.

A creature in the aura takes a -2 circumstance penalty to saves against mental effects and can't take actions that have the concentrate trait unless they succeed at a DC 10 flat check. Failing this check wastes the action.

@Compendium[pf2e.bestiary-effects.jrfuplUEq3PIo6j1]{Effect: Blasphemous Utterances}

(Skeleton) Blaze.name: (Skeleton) Blaze
(Skeleton) Blaze.description:
The skeleton is wreathed with fire, which doesn't consume its bones or gear.

The skeleton gains immunity to fire and weakness 5 to cold, loses its resistance to cold, and its Strikes deal additional persistent fire damage equal to half the skeleton's level (minimum 1 damage).

(Vampire, True) Dominate.name: (Vampire, True) Dominate
(Vampire, True) Dominate.description:
The vampire can cast @Compendium[pf2e.spells-srd.OsOhx3TGIZ7AhD0P]{Dominate} at will as a divine innate spell. Casting it requires staring into the target's eyes, giving the spell the visual trait. The save DC uses the DC of the vampire's level, and a creature that succeeds is temporarily immune to that vampire's Dominate for 24 hours.

Fully destroying the vampire ends the domination, but merely reducing the vampire to 0 HP is insufficient to break the spell.

(Ghost) Cold Spot.name: (Ghost) Cold Spot
(Ghost) Cold Spot.description:
@Template[type:emanation|distance:5|damaging:yes]{5 feet} @Compendium[pf2e.bestiary-ability-glossary-srd.v61oEQaDdcRpaZ9X]{Aura}

The air within 5 feet of the ghost is supernaturally cold. Characters that enter or begin their turn in the ghost's aura take [[/r {1d6}[cold]]]{1d6 cold damage} per 3 levels the ghost has (basic Fortitude save).

(Zombie) Unkillable.name: (Zombie) Unkillable
(Zombie) Unkillable.description:
This zombie is nigh unkillable. The zombie loses its weakness to slashing and gains resistance against all damage equal to its level (minimum 3), and it gains weakness equal to twice its level (minimum 6) to critical hits.

Increase the zombie's level by 1 if you give it this ability.

(Ghost) Site Bound.name: (Ghost) Site Bound
(Ghost) Site Bound.description: A typical ghost can stray only a short distance from where it was killed or the place it haunts. A typical limit is 120 feet. Some ghosts are instead bound to a room, building, item, or creature that was special to it rather than a location.

(Graveknight) Phantom Mount.name: (Graveknight) Phantom Mount
(Graveknight) Phantom Mount.description:
HP __; AC __, Fort +__, Ref +__, Will +__

The graveknight summons a supernatural mount as per @Compendium[pf2e.spells-srd.WPKJOhEihhcIm2uQ]{Phantom Steed}, heightened to a level equal to half the graveknight's level.

Unlike phantom steed, the steed's AC and saving throw bonuses are all 4 lower than the graveknight's, and the steed has one-third the graveknight's Hit Points (rounded down).

If the steed is destroyed, the graveknight must wait 1 hour before using this ability again.

(Zombie) Rotting Aura.name: (Zombie) Rotting Aura
(Zombie) Rotting Aura.description:
@Template[type:emanation|distance:10]{10 Feet} @Compendium[pf2e.bestiary-ability-glossary-srd.v61oEQaDdcRpaZ9X]{Aura}

The zombie emits an aura of rot and disease that causes wounds to fester and turn sour.

Any living creature that starts its turn within 10 feet of the zombie and is not at full Hit Points takes [[/r {1d6}]]{1d6 damage} as its wounds fester. This damage increases by 1d6 for every 6 levels the zombie has.

Creatures that take a critical hit from the zombie also take this damage immediately.

(Divine Warden) Divine Innate Spells.name: (Divine Warden) Divine Innate Spells
(Divine Warden) Divine Innate Spells.description: A divine warden whose patron deity has any alignment components gains @Compendium[pf2e.spells-srd.qwZBXN6zBoB9BHXE]{Divine Lance} as an innate cantrip. A divine warden with a neutral patron deity instead gains @Compendium[pf2e.spells-srd.4gBIw4IDrSfFHik4]{Daze} as an innate cantrip.

(Goblin) Goblin Scuttle.name: (Goblin) Goblin Scuttle
(Goblin) Goblin Scuttle.description:
Trigger A goblin ally ends a move action adjacent to the goblin.

Effect The goblin @Compendium[pf2e.actionspf2e.UHpkTuCtyaPqiCAB]{Steps}.

(Werecreature) Moon Frenzy.name: (Werecreature) Moon Frenzy
(Werecreature) Moon Frenzy.description:
When a full moon appears in the night sky, the werecreature must enter hybrid form, can't Change Shape thereafter, becomes one size larger, increases its reach by 5 feet, and increases the damage of its jaws Strike (or a similar Strike) by 2.

When the moon sets or the sun rises, the werecreature returns to humanoid form and is @Compendium[pf2e.conditionitems.HL2l2VRSaQHu9lUw]{Fatigued} for [[/br 2d4 #hours]]{2d4 hours}.

(Ghoul) Paralysis.name: (Ghoul) Paralysis
(Ghoul) Paralysis.description: Any living, non-elf creature hit by a ghoul's attack must succeed at a Fortitude save or become @Compendium[pf2e.conditionitems.6uEgoh53GbXuHpTF]{Paralyzed}. It can attempt a new save at the end of each of its turns, and the DC cumulatively decreases by 1 on each such save.

(Vampire, Basic) Coffin Restoration.name: (Vampire, Basic) Coffin Restoration
(Vampire, Basic) Coffin Restoration.description: Unlike other undead, a vampire isn't destroyed at 0 HP. Instead, it falls @Compendium[pf2e.conditionitems.fBnFDH2MTzgFijKf]{Unconscious}. If its body rests in its coffin for 1 hour, the vampire gains 1 HP, after which its @Compendium[pf2e.bestiary-ability-glossary-srd.fJSNOw4zHGbIm4bZ]{Fast Healing} begins to function normally.

(Skeleton) Skeleton of Roses.name: (Skeleton) Skeleton of Roses
(Skeleton) Skeleton of Roses.description:
Thick briars have grown through the skeleton's bones, covering it in red roses with inch-long thorns.

The skeleton's unarmed melee Strikes deal additional piercing damage equal to 1/3 the skeleton's level (minimum 1 damage).

At the end of each of its turns, if the skeleton has caused piercing damage with its thorns, it regains HP equal to its level (minimum 1). Each time the skeleton regains HP in this way, another rose blossoms.

(Werecreature) Curse of the Werecreature.name: (Werecreature) Curse of the Werecreature
(Werecreature) Curse of the Werecreature.description:
This curse affects only humanoids.

Saving Throw Fortitude DC is the standard DC for the werecreature's new level -1.

On each full moon, the cursed creature must succeed at another Fortitude save or turn into the same kind of werecreature until dawn.

The creature is under the GM's control and goes on a rampage for half the night before falling unconscious until dawn.

(Graveknight) Devastating Blast.name: (Graveknight) Devastating Blast
(Graveknight) Devastating Blast.description:
The graveknight unleashes a 30-foot cone of energy.

Creatures in the area take [[/r 1d12 #____]]{1d12 ____ damage}, plus an additional 1d12 damage for every two levels the graveknight has (basic Reflex save).

The graveknight can use this ability once every [[/br 1d4 #rounds]]{1d4 rounds}.

This energy damage is of the same type as that of its ruinous weapons; Devastating Blast gains the associated energy trait.

(Ghost) Inhabit Object.name: (Ghost) Inhabit Object
(Ghost) Inhabit Object.description:
The ghost possesses an object of size Large or smaller within 20 feet, making it an animated object. This animated object's level can be no higher than the ghost's level -2. If the target object is being held by a creature, the bearer can attempt a Will save to prevent the possession.

This possession ends when the object is destroyed or the ghost leaves it. At this point, the ghost reappears in the object's square and can't Inhabit an Object again for [[/br 1d4 #rounds]](1d4 rounds}.

(Skeleton) Collapse.name: (Skeleton) Collapse
(Skeleton) Collapse.description:
Trigger The skeleton is critically hit.

Effect The skeleton collapses into a pile of bones and the attack deals only normal damage. The skeleton can reform in a standing position as an action, but until it does, it is @Compendium[pf2e.conditionitems.eIcWbB5o3pP6OIMe]{Immobilized} and @Compendium[pf2e.conditionitems.AJh5ex99aV6VTggg]{Flat-Footed}.

(Greater Barghest) Mutation - Toxic Brea.name: (Greater Barghest) Mutation - Toxic Breath
(Greater Barghest) Mutation - Toxic Brea.description:
The barghest breathes a cloud of toxic gas that deals [[/r 8d6[poison]]]{8d6 poison damage} to all creatures in a 30-foot Cone (basic Fortitude save).

It can't use Toxic Breath again for [[/br 1d4 #rounds]]{1d4 rounds}.

(Divine Warden) Instrument of Faith.name: (Divine Warden) Instrument of Faith
(Divine Warden) Instrument of Faith.description: The divine warden is a beacon for its deity's faith. A cleric of the divine warden's patron deity can channel a @Compendium[pf2e.spells-srd.rfZpqmj0AIIdkVIs]{Heal} spell through a divine warden they can see within 60 feet. The cleric determines any targets or area for the spell as if they were standing in the divine warden's space.

(Skeleton) Screaming Skull.name: (Skeleton) Screaming Skull
(Skeleton) Screaming Skull.description:
The skeleton removes its skull and throws it, making a jaws attack with a range of 20 feet. It then attempts to @Compendium[pf2e.actionspf2e.2u915NdUyQan6uKF]{Demoralize} each foe within 10 feet of the target.

The head bounces, rolls, or even flies back, returning to the skeleton at the start of its next turn. The skeleton is @Compendium[pf2e.conditionitems.XgEqL1kFApUbl5Z2]{Blinded} until then.

(Zombie) Plague-Ridden.name: (Zombie) Plague-Ridden
(Zombie) Plague-Ridden.description:
The zombie carries a plague that can create more of its own kind.

This functions as the @Compendium[pf2e.pathfinder-bestiary.KxN9aGFGPxl6oLGF]{Plague Zombie's} zombie rot, except at stage 5, the victim rises as another of the zombie's type, rather than a plague zombie.

Zombie Rot

An infected creature can't heal damage it takes from zombie rot until it has been cured of the disease.

Saving Throw Fortitude;

Stage 1 carrier with no ill effect (1 day);

Stage 2 [[/r {1d6}[negative]]]{1d6 negative damage} (1 day);

Stage 3 [[/r {1d6}[negative]]]{1d6 negative damage} (1 day);

Stage 4 [[/r {1d6}[negative]]]{1d6 negative damage} (1 day);

Stage 5 dead, rising as another of the zombie's type immediately

(Ghoul) Ghoul Fever.name: (Ghoul) Ghoul Fever
(Ghoul) Ghoul Fever.description:
Saving Throw Fortitude;

Stage 1 carrier with no ill effect (1 day);

Stage 2 [[/r {2d6}[negative]]]{2d6 negative damage} and regains half as many Hit Points from all healing (1 day);

Stage 3 as stage 2 (1 day);

Stage 4 [[/r {2d6}[negative]]]{2d6 negative damage} and gains no benefit from healing (1 day);

Stage 5 as stage 4 (1 day);

Stage 6 dead, and rises as a @Compendium[pf2e.pathfinder-bestiary.LHHgGSs0ELCR4CYK]{Ghoul} the next midnight.

(Vampire, True) Turn to Mist.name: (Vampire, True) Turn to Mist
(Vampire, True) Turn to Mist.description:
The vampire turns into a cloud of vapor, as the @Compendium[pf2e.spells-srd.V8wXOsoejQhe6CyG]{Gaseous Form} spell, or back to its normal form. The vampire loses @Compendium[pf2e.bestiary-ability-glossary-srd.fJSNOw4zHGbIm4bZ]{Fast Healing} while in gaseous form.

The vampire can remain in this form indefinitely.

(Greater Barghest) Mutation - Wings.name: (Greater Barghest) Mutation - Wings
(Greater Barghest) Mutation - Wings.description: The barghest has malformed wings extending from its back. It gains a fly Speed of 25 feet.

(Graveknight) Channel Magic.name: (Graveknight) Channel Magic
(Graveknight) Channel Magic.description:
The graveknight redirects magical energies through its armor, allowing it to deliver magic through an attack.

The graveknight Casts a Spell that takes 1 or 2 actions to cast and requires a spell attack roll. The effects of the spell don't occur immediately but are imbued into an attack instead. The graveknight then makes a melee Strike with a weapon or unarmed attack. The spell is coupled with the attack, using the attack roll result to determine the effects of both the Strike and the spell.

This counts as two attacks for the graveknight's multiple attack penalty but doesn't apply the penalty until after it's completed Channeling Magic.

The graveknight can't use Channel Magic again for [[/br 1d4 #rounds]]{1d4 rounds}.

(Divine Warden) Faith Bound.name: (Divine Warden) Faith Bound
(Divine Warden) Faith Bound.description: A divine warden can't attack a creature that openly wears or displays the religious symbol of the divine warden's patron deity unless that creature uses a hostile action against the divine warden first. If the divine warden is intelligent, it can also attack a creature it believes isn't faithful to its deity or who wears the religious symbol as a ruse (typically after succeeding at a Perception check to Sense Motive).

(Skeleton) Bloody.name: (Skeleton) Bloody
(Skeleton) Bloody.description: The skeleton is covered in dripping blood and gains @Compendium[pf2e.bestiary-ability-glossary-srd.fJSNOw4zHGbIm4bZ]{Fast Healing} equal to its level.

(Graveknight) Dark Deliverance.name: (Graveknight) Dark Deliverance
(Graveknight) Dark Deliverance.description: The graveknight has positive resistance equal to its level.

(Skeleton) Bone Missile.name: (Skeleton) Bone Missile
(Skeleton) Bone Missile.description:
The skeleton yanks a rib from its ribcage to use as an arrow or javelin. The skeleton loses HP equal to its level (minimum 1), then makes a ranged Strike.

This uses the attack bonus of whichever of the skeleton's other Strikes has the highest attack bonus and deals piercing damage equal to that Strike's damage plus the skeleton's level (minimum 1).

(Ghast) Stench.name: (Ghast) Stench
(Ghast) Stench.description:
@Template[type:emanation|distance:10]{10 Feet} @Compendium[pf2e.bestiary-ability-glossary-srd.v61oEQaDdcRpaZ9X]{Aura}

A creature entering the aura or starting its turn in the aura must succeed at a Fortitude save or become @Compendium[pf2e.conditionitems.fesd1n5eVhpCSS18]{Sickened 1} (plus @Compendium[pf2e.conditionitems.xYTAsEpcJE1Ccni3]{Slowed 1} as long as it's sickened on a critical failure).

While within the aura, the creature takes a -2 circumstance penalty to saves against disease and to recover from the sickened condition. A creature that succeeds at its save is temporarily immune for 1 minute.

@Compendium[pf2e.bestiary-effects.wX9L6fbqVMLP05hn]{Effect: Ghast Stench}

(Ghoul) Swift Leap.name: (Ghoul) Swift Leap
(Ghoul) Swift Leap.description: The ghoul jumps up to half its Speed. This movement doesn't trigger reactions.

(Divine Warden) Faithful Weapon.name: (Divine Warden) Faithful Weapon
(Divine Warden) Faithful Weapon.description: A divine warden always wields its patron deity's favored weapon. If the weapon is a ranged weapon, the divine warden automatically generates new ammunition with each attack. For a divine warden of 4th level or higher, the deity's favored weapon gains the effects of a @Compendium[pf2e.equipment-srd.DxCuJKynlnMQZHgp]{Striking} rune while the divine warden wields it; at 12th level, these effects are of a @Compendium[pf2e.equipment-srd.KCQRFvUgbyclvOGi]{Greater Striking} rune, and at 19th level, they're instead of a @Compendium[pf2e.equipment-srd.woxl2FrrgAcJDu0t]{Major Striking} rune.

(Visitant) Noxious Breath.name: (Visitant) Noxious Breath
(Visitant) Noxious Breath.description:
The visitant exhales sharply, releasing pungent fumes from its lungs in a @Template[type:cone|distance:15]{15-foot cone}.

Each creature in the area must succeed at a Fortitude save or become @Compendium[pf2e.conditionitems.fesd1n5eVhpCSS18]{Sickened 1} (@Compendium[pf2e.conditionitems.fesd1n5eVhpCSS18]{Sickened 2} on a critical failure).

(Graveknight) Create Grave Squire.name: (Graveknight) Create Grave Squire
(Graveknight) Create Grave Squire.description:
The graveknight can gift a piece of its armor to a willing ally, which becomes its grave squire.

The graveknight can communicate telepathically with its squire at any distance, see through the squire's senses, and cast @Compendium[pf2e.spells-srd.qwlh6aDgi86U3Q7H]{Suggestion} as a divine innate spell through the telepathic link at will; the squire treats its degree of success as one step worse.

If the graveknight's main armor is destroyed, the squire's piece expands to cover the squire's body over [[/br 1d10 #days]]{1d10 days}, after which point it becomes the graveknight's new body.

The graveknight can have only one squire at a time, and must recover the gifted piece of armor if it wishes to create a new squire.

(Skeleton) Explosive Death.name: (Skeleton) Explosive Death
(Skeleton) Explosive Death.description:
When the skeleton is destroyed, its bones shatter and explode as the necromantic energy holding it together is released.

Adjacent creatures take [[/r {1d6}[slashing]]]{1d6 slashing damage} per 2 levels (minimum 1d6) with a basic Reflex save.

(Ghost) Corporeal Manifestation.name: (Ghost) Corporeal Manifestation
(Ghost) Corporeal Manifestation.description:
The ghost loses the incorporeal trait, temporarily increasing its Strength modifier to equal its Charisma modifier. The ghost loses its immunity to precision damage and its resistance to all damage while corporeal.

The ghost can resume being incorporeal by using this action again.

(Vampire, True) Drink Blood.name: (Vampire, True) Drink Blood
(Vampire, True) Drink Blood.description:
Requirement A @Compendium[pf2e.conditionitems.kWc1fhmv9LBiTuei]{Grabbed}, @Compendium[pf2e.conditionitems.6uEgoh53GbXuHpTF]{Paralyzed}, @Compendium[pf2e.conditionitems.VcDeM8A5oI6VqhbM]{Restrained}, @Compendium[pf2e.conditionitems.fBnFDH2MTzgFijKf]{Unconscious}, or willing creature is within the vampire's reach.

Effect The vampire sinks its fangs into that creature to drink its blood. This requires an Athletics check against the victim's Fortitude DC if the victim is grabbed and is automatic for any of the other conditions.

The victim is @Compendium[pf2e.conditionitems.4D2KBtexWXa6oUMR]{Drained 2} and the vampire regains HP equal to 10% of its maximum HP, gaining any excess HP as temporary Hit Points. Drinking Blood from a creature that's already drained doesn't restore any HP to the vampire but increases the victim's drain value by 1. A vampire can also consume blood that's been emptied into a vessel for sustenance, but it gains no HP from doing so.

A victim's drained condition decreases by 1 per week. A blood transfusion, which requires a Medicine check and sufficient blood or a blood donor, reduces the drain by 1 after 10 minutes.

(Lich) Paralyzing Touch.name: (Lich) Paralyzing Touch
(Lich) Paralyzing Touch.description:
A creature damaged by the lich's hand Strike must succeed at a Fortitude save against the lich's spell DC-4.

The creature becomes @Compendium[pf2e.conditionitems.6uEgoh53GbXuHpTF]{Paralyzed} for 1 round on a failure. On a critical failure, the creature is paralyzed permanently, falls @Compendium[pf2e.conditionitems.j91X7x0XSomq8d60]{Prone}, and seems dead. A Medicine check reveals the victim is alive.

(Graveknight) Rejunvenation.name: (Graveknight) Rejunvenation
(Graveknight) Rejunvenation.description:
When a graveknight is destroyed, its armor rebuilds its body over the course of [[/br 1d10 #days]]{1d10 days}-or more quickly if the armor is worn by a living host. If the body is destroyed before then, the process restarts.

A graveknight can only be permanently destroyed by obliterating its armor (such as with @Compendium[pf2e.spells-srd.r7ihOgKv19eJQnik]{Disintegrate}), transporting it to the Positive Energy Plane, or throwing it into the heart of a volcano.

(Vampire, True) Change Shape.name: (Vampire, True) Change Shape
(Vampire, True) Change Shape.description:
The vampire transforms into one of its animal forms or back into its normal form. Most vampires can turn into a bat, but some can turn into a different creature, such as a rat or a wolf.

Use the options in the @Compendium[pf2e.spells-srd.NzXpEzcZAjuDTZjK]{Aerial Form} and @Compendium[pf2e.spells-srd.wp09USMB3GIW1qbp]{Animal Form} spells as guidelines.

  • Bat The vampire changes into a @Compendium[pf2e.pathfinder-bestiary.VAWmwDA08ZLQd8lW]{Bat Swarm} or @Compendium[pf2e.pathfinder-bestiary.C9s5tBxVValC2HTE]{Giant Bat}. It gains echolocation 40 feet, a land Speed of 20 feet and a fly Speed of 30 feet, and a fangs Strike with the same attack bonus as its highest melee attack. These fangs deal the same amount of damage as the vampire's claws, but deal piercing damage rather than slashing damage.

@Localize[PF2E.NPC.Abilities.Glossary.ChangeShape]

(Lich) Rejuvenation.name: (Lich) Rejuvenation
(Lich) Rejuvenation.description: When a lich is destroyed, its soul immediately transfers to its phylactery. A lich can be permanently destroyed only if its phylactery is found and destroyed.

(Ghost) Frightful Moan.name: (Ghost) Frightful Moan
(Ghost) Frightful Moan.description:
The ghost laments its fate, forcing each living creature within 30 feet to attempt a Will save.

On a failure, a creature becomes @Compendium[pf2e.conditionitems.TBSHQspnbcqxsmjL]{Frightened 2} (or @Compendium[pf2e.conditionitems.TBSHQspnbcqxsmjL]{Frightened 3} on a critical failure). On a success, a creature is temporarily immune to this ghost's frightful moan for 1 minute.

(Lich) Siphon Life.name: (Lich) Siphon Life
(Lich) Siphon Life.description:
Trigger The lich deals damage with its hand Strike.

Effect The lich regains Hit Points equal to half the damage dealt.

(Graveknight) Sacrilegious Aura.name: (Graveknight) Sacrilegious Aura
(Graveknight) Sacrilegious Aura.description:
@Template[type:emanation|distance:30]{30 Feet} @Compendium[pf2e.bestiary-ability-glossary-srd.v61oEQaDdcRpaZ9X]{Aura}

When a creature in the aura uses a positive spell or ability, the graveknight automatically attempts to counteract it, with a counteract modifier of [[/r 1d10+0 #Counteract]]{+x}.

(Ghast) Paralysis.name: (Ghast) Paralysis
(Ghast) Paralysis.description: Any living creature hit by a ghast's attack must succeed at a Fortitude save or become @Compendium[pf2e.conditionitems.6uEgoh53GbXuHpTF]{Paralyzed}. It can attempt a new save at the end of each of its turns, and the DC cumulatively decreases by 1 on each such save.

(Vampire, Basic) Drink Blood.name: (Vampire, Basic) Drink Blood
(Vampire, Basic) Drink Blood.description:
Requirement A @Compendium[pf2e.conditionitems.kWc1fhmv9LBiTuei]{Grabbed}, @Compendium[pf2e.conditionitems.6uEgoh53GbXuHpTF]{Paralyzed}, @Compendium[pf2e.conditionitems.VcDeM8A5oI6VqhbM]{Restrained}, @Compendium[pf2e.conditionitems.fBnFDH2MTzgFijKf]{Unconscious}, or willing creature is within the vampire's reach.

Effect The vampire sinks its fangs into that creature to drink its blood. This requires an Athletics check against the victim's Fortitude DC if the victim is grabbed and is automatic for any of the other conditions.

The victim is @Compendium[pf2e.conditionitems.4D2KBtexWXa6oUMR]{Drained 1} and the vampire regains HP equal to 10% of its maximum HP, gaining any excess HP as temporary Hit Points. Drinking Blood from a creature that's already drained doesn't restore any HP to the vampire but increases the victim's drain value by 1. A vampire can also consume blood that's been emptied into a vessel for sustenance, but it gains no HP from doing so.

A victim's drained condition decreases by 1 per week. A blood transfusion, which requires a Medicine check and sufficient blood or a blood donor, reduces the drain by 1 after 10 minutes.

(Ghost) Phantasmagoria.name: (Ghost) Phantasmagoria
(Ghost) Phantasmagoria.description:
The ghost causes all or part of its bound site to look, sound, feel, and smell like a different kind of place, and can populate it with simple illusions of people or animals.

Typically, the ghost can recreate only a handful of images, usually different versions of its bound site as it appeared during the ghost's life. This can't disguise any creatures in the area, though it can cause minor, cosmetic changes (like causing a creature's clothing to appear nicer for a party or bloodstained for a battle).

Any creature that touches the illusion or uses the Seek action to examine it can attempt to disbelieve it. Creatures can't leave the area of the illusion until they successfully disbelieve it.

(Visitant) Vengeful Presence.name: (Visitant) Vengeful Presence
(Visitant) Vengeful Presence.description:
@Template[type:emanation|distance:20]{20 feet} @Compendium[pf2e.bestiary-ability-glossary-srd.v61oEQaDdcRpaZ9X]{Aura}.

A creature that starts its turn within the visitant's aura must succeed at a Will save or be overcome with a thirst for vengeance.

For [[/r 1d4 #rounds]]{1d4 rounds} (1 minute on a critical failure), if the affected creature was attacked within the last round (whether or not the attack hit), the creature must use at least 1 action per round to Strike or use a hostile action toward its last attacker as long as the attacker is still alive. Failure to do so deals the affected creature [[/r {1d6}[mental]]]{1d6 mental damage}, plus 1d6 for every 5 levels the visitant has.

(Lich) Dark Deliverance.name: (Lich) Dark Deliverance
(Lich) Dark Deliverance.description: The lich has resistance to positive equal to its level.

(Ghost) Draining Touch.name: (Ghost) Draining Touch
(Ghost) Draining Touch.description:
With a touch, the ghost attempts to drain a living creature's life force. It makes a ghostly hand Strike but deals no damage on a hit.

Instead, the target becomes @Compendium[pf2e.conditionitems.4D2KBtexWXa6oUMR]{Drained 1} for 1 day, and the ghost regains HP equal to half its own level.

(Graveknight) Clutching Armor.name: (Graveknight) Clutching Armor
(Graveknight) Clutching Armor.description:
Trigger A creature attempts to move away from the graveknight;

Effect The graveknight's armor animates and attempts to Grab the triggering creature. It makes an Athletics check to @Compendium[pf2e.actionspf2e.PMbdMWc2QroouFGD]{Grapple} using the graveknight's Athletics modifier - 2. The armor can continue to Grapple the creature normally.

Since the armor is grappling the creature, the graveknight doesn't need a free hand to do so.

(Lich) Drain Phylactery.name: (Lich) Drain Phylactery
(Lich) Drain Phylactery.description:
Frequency once per day;

Effect The lich taps into its phylactery's power to cast any arcane spell up to the highest level the lich can cast, even if the spell being cast is not one of the lich's prepared spells.

The lich's phylactery doesn't need to be present for the lich to use this ability.

(Ghost) Corrupting Gaze.name: (Ghost) Corrupting Gaze
(Ghost) Corrupting Gaze.description:
The ghost stares at a creature it can see within 30 feet. The target takes [[/r {1d6}[negative]]]{1d6 negative damage} + 1d6 per 2 levels with a basic Will save.

A creature that fails its save is also @Compendium[pf2e.conditionitems.e1XGnhKNSQIm5IXg]{Stupefied 1} for 1 minute.

(Ghast) Ghast Fever.name: (Ghast) Ghast Fever
(Ghast) Ghast Fever.description:
Saving Throw Fortitude;

Stage 1 carrier with no ill effect (1 day);

Stage 2 [[/r {3d8}[negative]]]{3d8 negative damage} and regains half as many Hit Points from all healing (1 day);

Stage 3 as stage 2 (1 day);

Stage 4 [[/r {3d8}[negative]]]{3d8 negative damage} and gains no benefit from healing (1 day);

Stage 5 as stage 4 (1 day);

Stage 6 dead, and rises as a @Compendium[pf2e.pathfinder-bestiary.VC7rtYR4hLxwg7WZ]{Ghast} the next midnight

(Ghost) Ghost Storm.name: (Ghost) Ghost Storm
(Ghost) Ghost Storm.description:
@Template[type:emanation|distance:30]{30 feet} @Compendium[pf2e.bestiary-ability-glossary-srd.v61oEQaDdcRpaZ9X]{Aura}

Wind surrounds the ghost out to a range of 30 feet. The wind extinguishes small non-magical fires, disperses fog and mist, blows objects of light Bulk or less around, and pushes larger objects. Squares in the ghost's aura are difficult terrain and flying creatures are always considered to be moving against the wind.

The ghost can dismiss or resume the wind as an action, which has the concentrate trait.

(Werecreature) Animal Empathy.name: (Werecreature) Animal Empathy
(Werecreature) Animal Empathy.description: A werecreature can communicate with animals of the same general kind.

(Zombie) Feast.name: (Zombie) Feast
(Zombie) Feast.description:
If the zombie is adjacent to a helpless or unconscious creature, or a deceased creature that died in the past hour, the zombie can feast upon its flesh to heal itself.

This restores an amount of Hit Points equal to the zombie's level. If the creature is alive, the zombie deals damage equal to its jaws, fist, or claw damage.

(Ghost) Malevolent Possession.name: (Ghost) Malevolent Possession
(Ghost) Malevolent Possession.description: The ghost attempts to possess an adjacent corporeal creature. This has the same effect as the @Compendium[pf2e.spells-srd.wU6hNzK8Yfqdmc8m]{Possession} spell, except since the ghost doesn't have a physical body, it is unaffected by that restriction of the spell.

(Ghoul) Consume Flesh.name: (Ghoul) Consume Flesh
(Ghoul) Consume Flesh.description:
Requirements The ghoul is adjacent to the corpse of a creature that died within the last hour.

Effect The ghoul devours a chunk of the corpse and regains [[/r {1d6}[healing]]]{1d6 Hit Points} plus 1d6 for every 2 levels it has.

It can regain Hit Points from any given corpse only once.

(Divine Warden) Divine Destruction.name: (Divine Warden) Divine Destruction
(Divine Warden) Divine Destruction.description:
When the divine warden is reduced to 0 HP, it erupts with divine energy in a 30-foot emanation, dealing [[/r {1d6}]]{1d6 damage} per level. This damage is either positive or negative, determined by the patron deity's divine font (chosen at the divine warden's creation if the deity offers a choice), and this ability gains the corresponding trait. Each creature in the area must attempt a Will save with the following outcomes.

Critical Success The creature takes half damage.

Success The creature takes full damage.

Failure The creature takes full damage and becomes temporarily cursed by the patron deity. The creature becomes @Compendium[pf2e.conditionitems.MIRkyAjyBeXivMa7]{Enfeebled 1} and @Compendium[pf2e.conditionitems.e1XGnhKNSQIm5IXg]{Stupefied 1} for 1 day; this is a curse effect that uses the Will save DC as the counteract DC.

Critical Failure As failure, except the creature becomes @Compendium[pf2e.conditionitems.MIRkyAjyBeXivMa7]{Enfeebled 2} and @Compendium[pf2e.conditionitems.e1XGnhKNSQIm5IXg]{Stupefied 2}.

(Ghost) Haunted House.name: (Ghost) Haunted House
(Ghost) Haunted House.description:
Frequency once every 10 minutes;

Effect The ghost extends its presence throughout its bound site until the end of its next turn. Within this area, the ghost can extend its senses, gaining the benefits of @Compendium[pf2e.bestiary-ability-glossary-srd.9qV49KjZujZnSp6w]{All-Around Vision}, and can make ghostly hand attacks or use special abilities originating from any part of the area.

(Vistant) Visitant Spells.name: (Vistant) Visitant Spells
(Vistant) Visitant Spells.description:
Some visitants can cast the following innate occult spells. If you give a visitant the following spells, consider removing one of its other special abilities.

Occult Innate Spells

DC varies

Spell Attack varies

1st @Compendium[pf2e.spells-srd.4koZzrnMXhhosn0D]{Fear}, @Compendium[pf2e.spells-srd.J7Y7tl0bbdz7TcCc]{Ray of Enfeeblement};

Constant (1st) @Compendium[pf2e.spells-srd.QnTtGCAvdWRU4spv]{Detect Alignment (evil only)}

(Ghast) Consume Flesh.name: (Ghast) Consume Flesh
(Ghast) Consume Flesh.description:
Requirements The ghast is adjacent to the corpse of a creature that died within the last hour.

Effect The ghast devours a chunk of the corpse and regains [[/r {2d6}[healing]]]{2d6 Hit Points} plus 1d6 for every 2 levels it has.

It can regain Hit Points from any given corpse only once.

(Dragon) Change Shape.name: (Dragon) Change Shape
(Dragon) Change Shape.description:
The dragon takes on the appearance of any Small or Medium humanoid. This doesn't change its Speed or attack and damage bonuses with its Strikes, but might change the damage type its Strikes deal (typically to bludgeoning).

@Localize[PF2E.NPC.Abilities.Glossary.ChangeShape]

(Graveknight) Graveknight's Shield.name: (Graveknight) Graveknight's Shield
(Graveknight) Graveknight's Shield.description:
The graveknight's curse extends to their shield, or the graveknight's armor uses a portion of itself to produce a shield.

The graveknight has a shield that uses the statistics of a @Compendium[pf2e.equipment-srd.f9ygr5Cjrmop8LWV]{Sturdy Shield} of a level no higher than the graveknight's level - 1.

The shield is quasi-independent of the graveknight and automatically protects the graveknight from harm. When the shield is raised, it automatically uses Shield Block to reduce the damage of the first attack against the graveknight each round without the graveknight needing to spend their reaction to do so.

The shield automatically rejuvenates with the rest of the graveknight and must be destroyed in the same manner as the graveknight's armor.

(Greater Barghest) Mutation - Vestigial.name: (Greater Barghest) Mutation - Vestigial Arm Strike
(Greater Barghest) Mutation - Vestigial.description:
Frequency once per round;

Trigger The barghest completes a Strike.

Effect The barghest makes a claw Strike with a shriveled third arm hanging from its torso. This attack doesn't count for the barghest's multiple attack penalty, nor does that penalty apply on the attack.

(Ghost) Memento Mori.name: (Ghost) Memento Mori
(Ghost) Memento Mori.description:
The ghost causes one creature within 30 feet to relive the ghost's death.

The target must succeed at a Will save or see and feel what the ghost did, taking [[/r {1d4}[persistent,mental]]] @Compendium[pf2e.conditionitems.lDVqvLKA6eF3Df60]{Persistent Mental Damage} per 2 levels the ghost has.

All other creatures are @Compendium[pf2e.conditionitems.DmAIPqOBomZ7H95W]{Concealed} to the target until the persistent damage ends.

(Vampire, True) Children of the Night.name: (Vampire, True) Children of the Night
(Vampire, True) Children of the Night.description:
The vampire's presence brings forth creatures of the night to do the master's bidding. These typically include @Compendium[pf2e.pathfinder-bestiary.sPClc6y3dT3XZupv]{Rat Swarms}, @Compendium[pf2e.pathfinder-bestiary.VAWmwDA08ZLQd8lW]{Bat Swarms}, and @Compendium[pf2e.pathfinder-bestiary.Oilfs8Atv2LjAsUS]{Wolves}, but can include other creatures.

The vampire can give telepathic orders to these creatures as long as they are within 100 feet, but they can't communicate back.

(Graveknight) Betrayed Revivification.name: (Graveknight) Betrayed Revivification
(Graveknight) Betrayed Revivification.description:
The graveknight died after being deeply betrayed.

Instead of being immune to a type of energy damage, it is immune to mental damage, its weapons deal [[/r {1d6}[mental]]]{1d6 additional mental damage}, and its Devastating Blast deals mental damage with a Will saving throw instead of Reflex.

(Golem) Golem Antimagic.name: (Golem) Golem Antimagic
(Golem) Golem Antimagic.description:
harmed by [damage type] ([[/r {0d8}]]{0d8 damage}, [[/r {0d4}]]{0d4 damage} from areas or persistent damage); healed by [damage type] (area [[/r {0d4}[healing]]]{0d4 Hit Points}); slowed by [damage type]

A golem is immune to spells and magical abilities other than its own, but each type of golem is affected by a few types of magic in special ways. These exceptions are listed in shortened form in the golem's stat block, with the full rules appearing here. If an entry lists multiple types (such as “cold and water”), either type of spell can affect the golem.

  • Harmed By Any magic of this type that targets the golem causes it to take the listed amount of damage (this damage has no type) instead of the usual effect. If the golem starts its turn in an area of magic of this type or is affected by a persistent effect of the appropriate type, it takes the damage listed in the parenthetical.
  • Healed By Any magic of this type that targets the golem makes the golem lose the slowed condition and gain HP equal to half the damage the spell would have dealt. If the golem starts its turn in an area of this type of magic, it gains the HP listed in the parenthetical.
  • Slowed By Any magic of this type that targets the golem causes it to be @Compendium[pf2e.conditionitems.xYTAsEpcJE1Ccni3]{Slowed 1} for [[/r 2d6 #rounds]]{2d6 rounds} instead of the usual effect. If the golem starts its turn in an area of this type of magic, it's slowed 1 for that round.
  • Vulnerable To Each golem is vulnerable to one or more specific spells, with the effects described in its stat block.

(Vampire, True) Mist Escape.name: (Vampire, True) Mist Escape
(Vampire, True) Mist Escape.description:
Trigger The vampire is reduced to 0 HP.

Effect The vampire uses Turn to Mist. It can take move actions to move toward its coffin even though it's at 0 HP. While at 0 HP in this form, the vampire is unaffected by further damage.

It automatically returns to its corporeal form, unconscious, if it reaches its coffin or after 2 hours, whichever comes first.

(Skeleton) Bone Powder.name: (Skeleton) Bone Powder
(Skeleton) Bone Powder.description:
When the skeleton takes physical damage from a critical hit, one of its bones is pulverized into a fine powder.

All creatures in a 5-foot emanation that breathe take [[/r 1d6 #persistent poison]] @Compendium[pf2e.conditionitems.lDVqvLKA6eF3Df60]{Persistent Poison Damage} (plus an additional 1d6 for every 6 levels the skeleton has).

(Ghost) Fetch.name: (Ghost) Fetch
(Ghost) Fetch.description:
The ghost creates an illusory double of a creature. The fetch functions as a 2nd-level @Compendium[pf2e.spells-srd.f8SBoXiXQjlCKqly]{Illusory Creature}, except that the ghost doesn't control the fetch, and the spell lasts for [[/r 1d4 #hours]]{1d4 hours} instead of needing to Sustain the Spell.

The fetch has a rudimentary intelligence and tries to imitate its original (it has a Deception skill value equal to the ghost's highest skill) but comes across as @Compendium[pf2e.conditionitems.yblD8fOR1J8rDwEQ]{Confused} or vague.

A ghost can have only one fetch at a time. If the creature doubled by the fetch encounters it, the creature must succeed at a Will save or become @Compendium[pf2e.conditionitems.e1XGnhKNSQIm5IXg]{Stupefied 1} (@Compendium[pf2e.conditionitems.e1XGnhKNSQIm5IXg]{Stupefied 2} on a critical failure) for as long as they can see the fetch.

(Ghost) Dreamwalker.name: (Ghost) Dreamwalker
(Ghost) Dreamwalker.description:
Anyone who meets the ghost or visits its bound site can become subject to this effect. The first time the subject sleeps after their ghostly encounter, they're targeted by a @Compendium[pf2e.spells-srd.Uqj344bezBq3ESdq]{Nightmare} spell, with the nightmares being somehow related to the ghost.

Most often this means that the subject relives the ghost's last moments alive, but there are other possibilities. If the ghost wishes, it can manipulate the dreams to send messages or even hold entire conversations with dreamers.

(Ghost) Rejuvenation.name: (Ghost) Rejuvenation
(Ghost) Rejuvenation.description: When a ghost is destroyed, it re-forms after [[/br 2d4 #days]]{2d4 days} within the location it's bound to, fully healed. A ghost can be permanently destroyed only if someone determines the reason for its existence and sets right whatever prevents the spirit from resting.

(Zombie) Disgusting Pustules.name: (Zombie) Disgusting Pustules
(Zombie) Disgusting Pustules.description:
The zombie is covered in pustules that rupture when it takes any piercing damage or any critical hit.

In either case, adjacent creatures are hit with vile fluid, causing them to become @Compendium[pf2e.conditionitems.fesd1n5eVhpCSS18]{Sickened 1} unless they succeed at a Fortitude save.

(Visitant) Roar.name: (Visitant) Roar
(Visitant) Roar.description:
The visitant lets out a loud and horrifying roar. Each creature within @Template[type:emanation|distance:100]{100 feet} must attempt at a Will save.

No matter the result, affected creatures are then temporarily immune to the effect for 1 minute.

Critical Success The creature is unaffected.

Success The creature is @Compendium[pf2e.conditionitems.TBSHQspnbcqxsmjL]{Frightened 1}.

Failure The creature is @Compendium[pf2e.conditionitems.TBSHQspnbcqxsmjL]{Frightened 2}.

Critical Failure The creature is @Compendium[pf2e.conditionitems.TBSHQspnbcqxsmjL]{Frightened 3}.

(Lich) Cold Beyond Cold.name: (Lich) Cold Beyond Cold
(Lich) Cold Beyond Cold.description:
The lich's hand Strike deals cold damage instead of negative, and instead of being paralyzed, the target is @Compendium[pf2e.conditionitems.xYTAsEpcJE1Ccni3]{Slowed 2}.

A successful Fortitude save reduces this to @Compendium[pf2e.conditionitems.xYTAsEpcJE1Ccni3]{Slowed 1} (or negates it on a critical success).

(Greater Barghest) Mutation - Poison Fan.name: (Greater Barghest) Mutation - Poison Fangs
(Greater Barghest) Mutation - Poison Fan.description: The barghest grows elongated fangs that seep poison. Its jaws deal [[/r 1d6[poison]]]{1d6 additional poison damage} and [[/r {1d6}[persistent,poison]]] @Compendium[pf2e.conditionitems.lDVqvLKA6eF3Df60]{Persistent Poison Damage}.

(Vampire, True) Create Spawn.name: (Vampire, True) Create Spawn
(Vampire, True) Create Spawn.description:
If a creature dies after being reduced to 0 HP by Drink Blood, the vampire can turn this victim into a vampire by donating some of its own blood to the victim and burying the victim in earth for 3 nights.

If the new vampire is lower level than its creator, it is under the creator's control. If a vampire controls too many spawn at once (as determined by the GM), strong-willed spawn can free themselves by succeeding at a Will saving throw against the vampire's Will DC.

(Ghost) Revenant.name: (Ghost) Revenant
(Ghost) Revenant.description:
The ghost possesses and transforms an adjacent corpse (this requires 2 actions if the ghost is possessing its own corpse; otherwise, it takes an hour).

The possessed corpse uses the statistics of a non-incorporeal undead 2 levels lower than the ghost, and the ghost possesses it as if using the @Compendium[pf2e.spells-srd.wU6hNzK8Yfqdmc8m]{Possession} spell. The specific undead is determined by the nature of the ghost and the corpse-@Compendium[pf2e.pathfinder-bestiary.LHHgGSs0ELCR4CYK]{Ghouls}, @Compendium[pf2e.pathfinder-bestiary.ZPjQkKVMi3xoPcU0]{Wights}, and @Compendium[pf2e.pathfinder-bestiary.0SJqmk4ItwL31Rg9]{Dullahans} are all common, but almost any undead is possible.

If the ghost ceases to possess the corpse, the corporeal undead is immediately destroyed.

(Clockwork Creature) Wind-Up.name: (Clockwork Creature) Wind-Up
(Clockwork Creature) Wind-Up.description:
For a clockwork to act, it must be wound with a unique key by another creature. This takes 1 minute. Once wound, it remains operational for the listed amount of time, usually 24 hours, after which time it becomes unaware of its surroundings and can't act until it's wound again. Some clockworks' abilities require them to spend some of their remaining operational time. They can't spend more than they have and shut down immediately once they have 0 time remaining. If it's unclear when a clockwork was last wound, most clockwork keepers wind all their clockworks at a set time, typically 8 a.m.

A clockwork that lists standby in its wind-up entry can enter standby mode as a 3-action activity. Its operational time doesn't decrease in standby, but it can sense its surroundings (with a –2 penalty to Perception). It can't act, with one exception: when it perceives a creature, it can exit standby as a reaction (rolling initiative if appropriate).

A creature can attempt to Disable a Device to wind a clockwork down (with a DC listed in the wind-up entry). For each success, the clockwork loses 1 hour of operational time. This can be done even if the clockwork is in standby mode.

(Lich) Void Shroud.name: (Lich) Void Shroud
(Lich) Void Shroud.description:
@Template[type:emanation|distance:30]{30 Feet} @Compendium[pf2e.bestiary-ability-glossary-srd.v61oEQaDdcRpaZ9X]{Aura}

The lich is surrounded by an aura of death, drawing forth souls to be consumed by the lich's constant hunger.

Living creatures in the emanation take a -2 status penalty to saves against fear and death effects. In addition, any creature that starts its turn in the area gains the @Compendium[pf2e.conditionitems.3uh1r86TzbQvosxv]{Doomed 1} condition unless it succeeds at a Will save against the lich's spell DC-4.

@Compendium[pf2e.bestiary-effects.i3942RucZD9OHbAE]{Effect: Void Shroud}
